segments.text: I notice the woman diligently polishing a plate, lost in her work while the world around her unravels.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The way the water spills over the sink is almost poetic in its chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But then my gaze shifts to the two children, and my heart races with dread.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is climbing that unstable stool like he's chasing a dream, and I can't help but feel panic rising in me.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Doesn’t he understand the danger he’s in?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister’s excitement only intensifies my fears; she really believes she's going to get a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Watching them together, part of me wants to laugh at their audacity, but I can’t shake off this feeling of impending disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like I’m watching a train wreck in slow motion.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside seems to mock the turmoil within these walls, a calm oasis while chaos brews inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could call out, to snap them out of this reckless moment, but I remain a silent observer.
segments.speaker: PAR
